Cortana coming to Outlook: it will read your emails and set up meetings for you on iOS and then Android (photo)
There are several news announced today that will unfold over the next few months, but for now they will be exclusive to the US
06 Nov 2019, 17:47 by Roberto Artigiani
The market for intelligent assistants is becoming increasingly crowded and, by definition, competitive. To avoid confrontation / confrontation with the heavyweights of Google and Amazon, Microsoft has decided to parade itself redefining Cortana not as a rival, but as a tool that strengthens its services. The renewed ambitions have become evident with the integration of the bot into Skype and above all with the repositioning of the development team from the AI sector to the one called "Experiences and Devices".
As part of the new strategy, the assistant will be integrated into the Outlook app, initially on iOS and only later (spring 2020) also on Android. This is a long-awaited event that will become reality in the coming weeks. The Cortana landing will also bring other news, including the possibility of having your e-mails read (by connecting headphones) - called Play My Emails - to generate a daily report of important events and set up an appointment even with several guests.
In this way the repositioning from IA to all-round to a personal assistant for productivity seems to be complete. Cortana, thanks to the work done on intonation, should read more naturally and the exchange should be more discursive than in the past. All this, together with a new male voice, will be available only for Office 365 users in the United States, the arrival in Italy has not been mentioned, but we are sure that it will be only a matter of time (hopefully not too much).
